channel.title: Comments on: Monday Go Meditation: Game 48

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I appreciate your kind words, but I still have a long way to go. I was just fortunate not to get out read this game.
item.content:encoded: I appreciate your kind words, but I still have a long way to go. I was just fortunate not to get out read this game.

item.title: By: scott
item.dc:creator: scott
item.description: Wow! You are getting really good!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Don't forget that this was a game between high SDK's, even we didn't really see it until we had more or less played it out. The fact that you could recognize that White had taken a bullet to the brain shows that your L&D skills are probably higher than DDK.
item.content:encoded: Don’t forget that this was a game between high SDK’s, even we didn’t really see it until we had more or less played it out. The fact that you could recognize that White had taken a bullet to the brain shows that your L&D skills are probably higher than DDK.

item.title: By: Xezlec
item.dc:creator: Xezlec
item.description: I liked the little L&D problem in the upper-right. One of the few things in Go that I can actually understand a little bit. But it wasn't until move 50 that it was visually obvious to me that white had taken a bullet to the brain. That's how I know I'm still DDK, lol.
item.content:encoded: I liked the little L&D problem in the upper-right. One of the few things in Go that I can actually understand a little bit. But it wasn’t until move 50 that it was visually obvious to me that white had taken a bullet to the brain. That’s how I know I’m still DDK, lol.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I sometimes wonder if my willingness to use big moyo type strategies is just an expression of greed or whether it's actually a good thing. In terms of my willingness to cut, I would have to say that it is perhaps the most important thing I remember from the one private lesson I had with Shifu years ago. "Gold move is always top priority. If you can cut, then you should cut!"And then when you combine that with my propensity towards fighting, I guess it synergies well together. Haha. Our games always push me to try and find the most severe move possible. And whenever you play a move, I also have to say that I usually feel a big pressure not to fall into a trap or to try and find the best counter to your attacks. Looking forward to our next game.
item.content:encoded:
I sometimes wonder if my willingness to use big moyo type strategies is just an expression of greed or whether it’s actually a good thing.
In terms of my willingness to cut, I would have to say that it is perhaps the most important thing I remember from the one private lesson I had with Shifu years ago. “Gold move is always top priority. If you can cut, then you should cut!”And then when you combine that with my propensity towards fighting, I guess it synergies well together. Haha.
Our games always push me to try and find the most severe move possible. And whenever you play a move, I also have to say that I usually feel a big pressure not to fall into a trap or to try and find the best counter to your attacks.
Looking forward to our next game.

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: I think it does expose a relative weakness in my game and a relative strength in yours. Your willingness to use big frameworks is slightly unusual at our level, and puts me a bit off-kilter... I'm not as good at finding the honte move when facing that style. Your other big strength, of course, is your willingness to cut. I went over the joseki that follows from the cut at O4 a bunch with Shifu, and it's not easy at all for either player, but it seems as if that's the only kind of game that even interests you, which is awesome. Even if you can't always play to match your ambition (here, that sequence ended in a gain for white, even if white promptly gave up that gain), it's like a guiding star for your game, leading you to get stronger and stronger. I think I'm a little that way, too, so don't think I'm purely dishing out selfless praise. It's a good attitude to nurture.
item.content:encoded:
I think it does expose a relative weakness in my game and a relative strength in yours. Your willingness to use big frameworks is slightly unusual at our level, and puts me a bit off-kilter… I’m not as good at finding the honte move when facing that style.
Your other big strength, of course, is your willingness to cut. I went over the joseki that follows from the cut at O4 a bunch with Shifu, and it’s not easy at all for either player, but it seems as if that’s the only kind of game that even interests you, which is awesome. Even if you can’t always play to match your ambition (here, that sequence ended in a gain for white, even if white promptly gave up that gain), it’s like a guiding star for your game, leading you to get stronger and stronger.
I think I’m a little that way, too, so don’t think I’m purely dishing out selfless praise. It’s a good attitude to nurture.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I can't believe I missed that.... oy vey.... And don't be so hard on White, he put up a valiant fight that presented multiple opportunities for me to make mistakes and allow him to turn the game around. It was far from an easy game.
item.content:encoded:
I can’t believe I missed that…. oy vey….
And don’t be so hard on White, he put up a valiant fight that presented multiple opportunities for me to make mistakes and allow him to turn the game around. It was far from an easy game.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: You're welcome! And if you ever have any questions or need help reviewing your games, be sure to let me know!
item.content:encoded: You’re welcome! And if you ever have any questions or need help reviewing your games, be sure to let me know!

item.title: By: RisingStar
item.dc:creator: RisingStar
item.description: Haha XD If I were to say anything, it would probably be about move 23. Couldn't you have gone to R2 and saved the corner with influence toward the center? An extension at M7 later would have worked.
item.content:encoded:
Haha XD
If I were to say anything, it would probably be about move 23. Couldn’t you have gone to R2 and saved the corner with influence toward the center? An extension at M7 later would have worked.

item.title: By: Moboy78
item.dc:creator: Moboy78
item.description: *jokingly says* Yeah, white sure made some dubious moves. Step it up white >:( *ends jovial tone* xD
item.content:encoded: *jokingly says* Yeah, white sure made some dubious moves. Step it up white >:( *ends jovial tone* xD
